Reentrancy in BaseHandler.useCurrentTimestampThenIncreaseTimestampBy(uint256) (test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#98-102):
	External calls:
	- vm.warp(currentTimestamp) (test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#99)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- handler_increaseTimestampBy(timeToIncrease) (test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#101)
		- currentTimestamp = newTimestamp (test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#108)
	BaseHandler.currentTimestamp (test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#28) can be used in cross function reentrancies:
	- BaseHandler.handler_increaseTimestampBy(uint256) (test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#104-109)
markdown:
Reentrancy in [BaseHandler.useCurrentTimestampThenIncreaseTimestampBy(uint256)](test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#L98-L102):
	External calls:
	- [vm.warp(currentTimestamp)](test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#L99)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- [handler_increaseTimestampBy(timeToIncrease)](test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#L101)
		- [currentTimestamp = newTimestamp](test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#L108)
	[BaseHandler.currentTimestamp](test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#L28) can be used in cross function reentrancies:
	- [BaseHandler.handler_increaseTimestampBy(uint256)](test/invariants/BaseHandler.sol#L104-L109)
